content.description: sit start with a left hand gaston in the low slot on the left edge of the face of the boulder, right hand in the double pocket/divots.   you will have a low left foot, and then up with a high tucked right foot to balance on.   Bump you left hand up to the next slot up. press up to a balance intensive move, far up to a solid ledge with your left hand and top out.
content.location: When you walk up to the Light Boulder from the steps you will meet the boulder with an arete closest to you. walk counter-clockwise around the boulder, past the two overhanging faces to the back of the boulder where it is at a slight slab incline.   the sit-start is a left hand in the slot on the left edge of the boulder as a gastone. your right hand in the double low pocket/divots.

content.description: this boulder is about as tall as the spray boulder or a little taller in the front, but more overhanging. It has a unique feature where there is a nearby street lap that illuminates the trail that meanders right beside the boulder. the light allows for extended night time bouldering sessions.   the most classic lines exist along the Light Boulders aretes and overhanging sides.
